H0.text: What science does Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's creation, Sherlock Holmes, practise. Criminology

H1.text: What science does Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's creation, Sherlock Holmes, practise. Psychology

H2.text: What science does Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's creation, Sherlock Holmes, practise. Forensics

H3.text: What science does Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's creation, Sherlock Holmes, practise. Detection

A4.text: Laura J. Snyder has examined Holmes's methods in the context of mid- to late-19th-century criminology, demonstrating that they were based upon existing methods and techniques.

A5.text: Holmes uses analytical chemistry for blood residue analysis and toxicology to detect poisons; Holmes's home chemistry laboratory is mentioned in 'The Naval Treaty'.

A6.text: In law enforcement, it is 'the fact of the police discovering information about crimes'.

A7.text: In general, detection is the action of accessing information without specific cooperation from or with the sender; it is 'the fact of noticing or discovering something'.
